bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter's] Secretary to the General Alumni Association, University of Virginia, July 6, 1920

div1.p: [Carter's] secretary requests that certain books be held until Carter returns from Peru.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter's] Secretary to the General Alumni Association, University of Virginia, July 6, 1920
div1.opener:
U. S. Marine Hospital.
Baltimore, Md.,
Jul6 6, 1920.
General Alumni Association,
Drawer 359,
University of Virginia, Va.
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
On my return to this office I find your card of June 11th. to
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter, acknowledging receipt of
fifteen dollars ($15.00) in full payment of Mr. Bruce's History of
the University of Virginia, concluding with your request that in
case of change of address you should be notified where to send them when published. behave if send them when published. I would respect-
I wld respect-fully call your attention to the fact that Dr. Carter expressly sti-
pulated that the books were not to be sent to his address at the
U. S. Marine Hospital, Baltimore, Md., but were to be held at the
publishers for him until he was able to send you a forwarding address
and that if this could not be done his order was to be cancelled.

Dr. Carter is at present in Peru, South America, where he ex-
pects to direct the sanitary work of the Peruvian Government until
Jan. 1921 and does not wish the books sent to him until his return
to the States, when he will probably be in Washington.
